issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Provide a way for NN to drain the local key cache before re-encryption

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This was caught from KMS acl testing.

HDFS-10899 gets the current key versions from KMS directly, which requires {{READ}} acls.
It also calls invalidateCache, which requires {{MANAGEMENT}} acls.

We should fix re-encryption to not require additional ACLs than original encryption.
fields.summary: Re-encryption should operate with minimum KMS ACL requirements.

This message was automatically generated.
Test failures not related, HDFS-12360, HDFS-12377 and HDFS-12378.

Hi [~xiaochen] thanks again for the patch.

Would you please add a test to demonstrate:
bq. We should fix re-encryption to not require additional ACLs than original encryption.

I would expect you have a test where it fails if the patch is reverted.
I see, didn't understand you were asking for a joint test case with KMS and ACL configured. Makes sense.
Added requested test, as well as minikms coverage for all base cases.

Cherry-picked this back to branch-3.0 for beta1 as well, thanks folks.
